issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
HIVE-13840 fixed some issues with addition file system invocations during split generation. Similarly, this jira will fix issues with additional file system invocations on the task side. To avoid reading footers on the task side, users can set hive.orc.splits.include.file.footer to true which will serialize the orc footers on the splits. But this has issues with serializing unwanted information like column statistics and other metadata which are not really required for reading orc split on the task side. We can reduce the payload on the orc splits by serializing only the minimum required information (stripe information, types, compression details). This will decrease the payload on the orc splits and can potentially avoid OOMs in application master (AM) during split generation. This jira also address other issues concerning the AM cache. The local cache used by AM is soft reference cache. This can introduce unpredictability across multiple runs of the same query. We can cache the serialized footer in the local cache and also use strong reference cache which should avoid memory pressure and will have better predictability.

One other improvement that we can do is when hive.orc.splits.include.file.footer is set to false, on the task side we make one additional file system call to know the size of the file. If we can serialize the file length in the orc split this can be avoided.
fields.summary: ORC improvements for reducing the file system calls in task side

comments.body: Targeting this patch for branch-2.1. Since orc is moving out in HIVE-14007 will wait for master commit. [~ashutoshc] fyi.
Attaching branch-1 and branch-2.1 patches
Can you create a RB entry for this?
Attaching RB for branch-1 patch

Here is a summary of changes
1) Added a new proto object FileTail (This is from c++ version https://github.com/apache/orc/blob/master/proto/orc_proto.proto#L227)
2) OrcTail is the class that wraps FileTail and serialized footer (ByteBuffer). 
    - FileTail is used in OrcSplit to serialize minimal footer in OrcSplit (strips off file level column statistics which is not required in task side)
    - OrcTail is cached by LocalCache (reconstructs every other objects from this)
3) Encodes file length in the OrcSplit which avoids 1 file system call to get file status on task side
4) Bunch of file system counters based unit tests to make sure we are not making excessive file system calls

[~sershe] could you please review the changes?
One more change is that local cache is updated to hard reference cache for better predictability.
Minor comment update.

[~sershe] Thanks for the review! Just removed that not so useful comment from proto file. For others commented on the RB. Can you take another look? The new patch is no different except for the removal of the comment.

Wrt the comment, I was hoping for a more useful one actually ;)

I am kind of concerned about hard vs soft references change. Couldn't this lead to OOM? The capacity is also removed. How is this cache ever reduced?

:) That file will go away after HIVE-14007.

Yeah hard references may cause OOM but atleast it will be consistent across runs. In case of OOM in AM we can easily guess it's because of local cache. But with soft references the split computation may vary dramatically under memory pressure leading to unpredictable overall query performance. That was the rationale behind making this change. initialCapacity is only removed. maximum capacity is still retained (for boundedness). Setting higher initialCapacity wastes memory unnecessarily. It's a tradeoff between wasting memory vs rehashing cost.
Hmm.. make it configurable? I dunno if we can easily guess what causes OOM, and esp. normal users cannot easily guess that.
Addressed [~sershe]'s review comments.
Done. Made it configurable. Can you plz take another look?
Made the default initial capacity for the cache to 1024.
With regen of protobuf code.
Rebased and added more tests for master branch
Fixes metastore cache test failure
What was the fix for those? Doesn't appear to be on RB
Btw, metastore cache needs to have metadata... I hope this is preserved. Otherwise it would be impossible to do the split generation without reading the file.

OrcTail preserves the entire serialized footer from which it derives metadata lazily. RB patch is for branch-1 only which does not have to have deal with metastore cache. Patch for master is where I fixed the metastore cache test failure. As I said before I am not going to commit to master until HIVE-14007. I have just uploaded the patch to kick off pre-commit test run.
K +1 for branch-1... there should probably be RB for master
Committed to branch-1. Thanks [~sershe] for the review! Will upload master patch to RB shortly
